cognitive_context.problem_understanding: Blog posts appeared as 'wall of text' due to missing @tailwindcss/typography plugin (causing prose-* classes to be no-ops), hidden list bullets (Tailwind reset removing defaults), and content width being too wide (max-w-4xl = 896px exceeds 50-75 char/line optimal).

attempted_solutions.outcome: FAILED - plugin not installed, classes did nothing
PARTIAL - lists still broken, inconsistent results

attempted_solutions.approach: Add explicit list styles to tailwind.config.ts
attempted_solutions.outcome: PARTIAL - bullets appeared but spacing wrong

attempted_solutions.approach: Create dedicated .blog-content CSS class from scratch
attempted_solutions.outcome: SUCCESS - full control over all typography elements

key_insights: @tailwindcss/typography is NOT included by default in Tailwind CSS
List bullets require explicit list-style-type: disc due to CSS resets
680px max-width achieves optimal 50-75 character line length with 18px font
Gold (#d4af37) brand color provides visual hierarchy for list markers
Blog posts use dangerouslySetInnerHTML - HTML structure in posts.ts matters
dead_ends: Trying to fix prose-* classes without installing plugin - impossible
Attempting incremental CSS tweaks - too many interdependent issues
assumptions: Gold-standard typography improves readability and engagement
Users expect visible list bullets and clear heading hierarchy
680px width is appropriate for the target audience
uncertainties: Whether images are needed in blog posts for engagement
Whether reading progress indicator adds value
User preference on exact spacing values
